techmeme.title: HR giant Workday says hackers stole an unspecified amount of personal information, like names and email addresses, from one of its third-party CRM platforms (Zack Whittaker/TechCrunch)
Google increases its stake in bitcoin miner and datacenter operator TeraWulf from 8% to 14%, bringing its total investment to ~$3.2B; WULF jumps 10%+ (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
Grok's website is exposing the underlying prompts for its AI personas, including one for a "crazy conspiracist" persona that spends "a lot of time on 4chan" (Joseph Cox/404 Media)
Samsung announces the Galaxy Buds3 FE, with a new AirPods Pro-like design, improved ANC, and upgraded audio quality, launching September 4 for $149.99 (Max Buondonno/The Shortcut)
A survey by Google Cloud and The Harris Poll finds 87% of game developers are using AI agents in their workflows; 63% expressed concerns about data ownership (Vic Hood/GamesIndustry.biz)
